The beautiful sunrise and sunset made our stay perfect!!
I want to give a bad review to keep others from booking Anna’s house so it will be available to me anytime I want it. But I just can’t do that.
10 out of 10, perfect score!!

review_text: Our stay at the Lake House was simply perfect! This home feels like "home". The lake is so very peaceful and the inside of the home is beautiful. The tranquil vibe is evident in this property. The check-in and check-out was so simple and easy to follow. The home was extremely clean and well stocked with needed items. One person in our party of 4 booked the Lake House for she and her husband in May for their anniversary because she loved it so much. It's a place that you'd just want to keep coming back to for a peaceful break. Not far away are different restaurants and quaint shopping as well. Anna, the host, is kind, helpful and very quick to respond to messages. Thank you for creating a place that provides a calm in a busy world.

name: Wyatt
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2023
,
·
Stayed with a pet
review_text:
Thankful for Anna! We got there on Tuesday and check in was easy, and the house was adorable and clean! It’s been completely redone and it shows.
Unfortunately we woke up at 5am on Wednesday to no water, we didn’t let her know until around 9, and she replied almost instantly. She had the neighbor (handy man) over right away and he started to find out what needed to be done. Unfortunately we decided to head home due to us only being there for a day anyway, but she texted us when it was back on and said we could head back, but we were already home. She then let us know that we could come back any weekend for free. How AMAZING is that? We will definitely be booking again in the future. She was very sweet, and easy to communicate with.
Something to note that this is a lake that’s more for kayaking or boating, not really swimming. But we saw so much wildlife while we were there and the view is completely worth it.
Thank you Anna! Really!

review_text:
I was coming back into New Castle to visit my family and found this listing and thought it looked super cute. I am SO glad we ended up booking through Jon. The house was on a quiet street and was close to my parent's house and Road 3 (where a lot of restaurants are). The house matched the pictures on the listing. It was cute, comfy and was the perfect size! There was a huge backyard with a seating area, a workout room, a coffee area and dining room.
Jon was so great. He explained all the house rules, was SO responsive to my emails and just made me feel welcome and important. We've already talked about booking here again when we go back into town. The only "complaint" I had, which wasn't a big deal was the lights outside the front door were so bright that they attracted what seemed like all the bugs in the neighborhood. So I was constantly trying to rush in without letting anything in. But I did appreciate all that light when we first showed up after it was dark.

So much I sent Jon a message asking him for the brand since I am in the market for a new bed myself. The small touch of having water bottles left on the table by the bed was such as sweet gesture. We are very happy that we decided to stay at this property for sure. Thanks again for everything!

We pulled out their card table and had a late night family game of cards along with the microwave popcorn they left us (sorry about what got on the floor!). Debbie left plenty of coffee, water, a nice fruit assortment, and fresh banana nut bread. That was a great bonus!
We had busy days booked so were unable to take the option to enjoy the lake or their local restaurant recommendation but we really appreciated that they offered. I also appreciated the small things like a place to plug in your phone at the nightstand and a flashlight on each side of the upstairs bed. Great value for 3 bedrooms and a sitting area.

,

Stayed one night
review_text:
This was the first time I used AIRBNB and I was so happy with my stay that I'm sure to use it again. As I was in the area for business, I didn't use the space as much as I would have if I brought my family. The upstairs bed was extremely comfortable. The Keurig and snacks were a very nice touch. The WiFi was fast enough that I could stream videos.
My hosts were much nicer than I expected. I didn't ask for a lot because the accommodations were great, but I believe they would have given whatever I needed. The breakfast in the morning was amazing! I was glad to sit at their table and talk with them. I enjoyed their company and wished I would have talked with them the night before to get to know them better.
The only thing I would recommend is more security on the doors. I would have liked a keypad or key to my area, and a bolted lock on both sides of the door between their living area and the rented area. There was a lock, but I'd like to see a dead bolt, one for each side to prevent unwanted intrusion from either party. However, I would have to add that the house was probably the safest in the neighborhood because a police officer lives across the street.
Overall, well done and I hope to stay at your place again Debbie!

review_text: We visited New Castle to meet our new grand baby. Jon & Ashlee’s place is cozy, clean, comfortable and perfect for the two of us. We arrived on a late flight but the porch light and inside lights were on to safely greet us. If the weather had been a bit warmer it would have been an easy walk to Pizza King, Jacks Donuts, and Dairy King. Anderson Casino was also a quick 30 minute drive. The provided washer and dryer were super convenient and allowed us to travel with only carry on luggage. As avid coffee lovers the large drip coffee pot and Nespresso machine were also an added bonus! The king size bed was also very comfortable for both of us (hard to find in an AirBNB)! We will be visiting New Castle quite often so Jon & Ashlee’s place will always be our first pick for accommodations!

Stayed with kids
review_text: This was our first Air BNB experience as we have always stayed at a hotel which was probably 20 minutes away. We stayed at the same hotel a couple times a year for the last 8 or so years. Our last stay was horrible. Broken outlets, broken shower & rooms were dirty. Their loss is Tim's Country Homes gain. Plus it is closer to our family. When we first pulled in you could feel the calm of his land. I knew if the outside was this inviting the inside had to be just as good if not better. The house was perfect. There was enough room for everyone to have their own space. The kitchen has probably everything you have at home. Even had a “junk drawer” with pens, paper & even a chip clip. There was a paper that explained the house rules & general info. It was easy to read and explained how to use the TV & how they wanted us to leave the house. We did not spend as much time there as I would have liked but we will be back. I cannot recommend Tim's house enough.

Two gals from WI, met two friends from MI at Timothy's home. We had an absolutely great time, enough room for each our own bedroom, and two bathrooms worked great as well. The home was located in an area with lots of things to see and do as well as great places to eat. We also cooked at the home with all the amenities at our fingertips. Private setting was perfect for four friends to hang out and eat drink and be merry, without bothering anyone. The outdoors were beautiful and we even took a walk on the trail through the woods. Waking up in the morning to the horses out the back patio door was a nice way to start the day. We can not say enough about how happy we were with our experience.
We wished this home was closer as we highly recommend it and will definitely go back again when headed that way.

This would be a great getaway for couples as there were several books/games available to re-get to know each other and share with each other. I would definitely recommend this location for couples. review_text: This is by far one of the best airbnbs that we have ever stayed at (we are counting our stays here by the handfuls at this point!). A simple getaway, thoughtful hosts, a unique setting, and absolutely adorable accommodations. This visit called for poor weather, so Kurt and Heidi set up the garage with some indoor games for the kids and I to play so we wouldn’t be bored—I call that definitely going above and beyond. It was well appreciated and they truly are the sweetest hosts. 100% would recommend. Also to note is the adorable downtown area, library with community garden, several Little Free Libraries in the area, and a bomb thrift shop that my daughter and I discovered. ♥️

It's the perfect little place for a weekend adventure to North Manchester and neighboring towns. We found antiques and oddities, a covered bridge, a waterfall, ice cream, and a great bar for hamburgers and rings! Plus, it has been decades since I won a game of Battleship! Truly enjoyed our stay and the story/pictures of how this place came to be. Thank you, Kurt and Heidi!

review_text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Shed Retreat. It was evident that a lot of care and thought has gone into making this little space as comfortable and welcoming as possible. For us, this stay checked all of our boxes, particularly being simple and affordable. The bathroom situation (toilet and shower outdoors) was no problem for us, and even added to the fun of our stay. I found myself especially appreciative of the house robes and shoes provided for our use - they made walking to the bathroom or using the shower a lot cleaner and easier than it could have been. Although we didn't meet Kurt and Heidi face to face during our stay, they were always quick to respond to questions, and available to help. I could certainly see us staying at the Shed Retreat again in the future. As parents it was the perfect little space to get away and reconnect for a couple days, without breaking the budget. We really appreciate what Kurt and Heidi have done with the space, and love that they've made it available.

review_text: What a cute and cozy little apartment in a peaceful setting, complete with a couple of really friendly cats and lovely chickens! The shed itself was warm, inviting and smelled wonderful inside. The hosts leave you to your own devices and honor privacy, while still responding quickly to communication through the Airbnb app. The toilet arrangement (a camp toilet outside and one you can take inside) most certainly isn’t for everyone. It was a little hard to handle at times, but certainly didn’t take away from my total experience. Also, because of the time of year, the outdoor shower on premises was not available (there are showers available at a local rec facility for a modest fee). If you can put up with these minor points, I would enthusiastically recommend this location to anyone visiting this area!

review_text: Great place for a little get away. A quaint goat barn turned into an escape I’ll never forget. I felt tranquility and peacefulness listening to the creek babble as I took in the vibrant Fall colors. The crunch of the leaves a few steps down a cute wooded path made me reminisce my childhood growing up in Michigan. At night, the fire pit area was illuminated and beautified by adorning lights- like fireflies of summers past. The kittens sat in my lap purring me awake the next morning while enjoying coffee out front on the deck. Kurt and Heidi hit the nail on the head with the details of my new escape. They pray for those who find their way to the Shed. And pray for you while you’re here. And my soul could feel their healing words. Thank you so much for sharing this sacred space.

name: Jean
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2021
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Shed Retreat is a little room in a beautifully peaceful setting out in the country. It's kind of a cross between a guest cottage and camping. The Shed itself is relatively close to Kurt & Heidi's house, yet is situated so it's surprisingly secluded and private, so it really IS perfect for a retreat.
Personally, my favorite part about my 2-night stay was probably just sitting inside, reading, writing, and coloring, with the windows open to let in the cool, fresh air. I also enjoyed an evening campfire (ate too many s'mores), walking down to the creek and the green grassy area (early a.m. squats & lunges), gathering fresh eggs, and practicing some "kitten yoga" (didn't know that was a thing, but the little grey guy thought I should try it).
The outside restroom is relatively convenient, clean, and comfortable. I feel that guests should be aware in advance that they are asked to do some of their own "maintenance" of the camp toilet, and that was not at all a problem for me.
Heidi and Kurt went out of their way to help me with a problem that came up (which was not related to their property), and I'm so appreciative of their assistance.
I didn't experience much in the town of North Manchester, but I did visit the History Museum, which was interesting and informative, and the Main View restaurant where I had a delicious lunch.
I hope I get an opportunity to stay at The Shed sometime in the future!

I checked out the fitness center one day. Walked downtown North Manchester for ice cream another day. And enjoyed reading and several cups of coffee by the fire. The chickens, fresh eggs and adorable kitties just added to the charm of the experience. Price was right and well worth it! Thanks Kurt and Heidi!

Stayed one night
review_text: If you like "glamping" this place is for you! It was an oasis of serenity and beauty, nestled in a sweet garden of hostas and shady trees. The chickens are near the parking and their sweet soft noises greeted us as we entered the very short path to the beautiful converted goat shed. If those goats could see this place now, they'd be in awe of it! The decor inside is darling and it had everything you needed, including A/C, electricity, a nice comfy chair, coffee table and love seat sitting area. The large bed was extremely comfy and the pillows were perfect. Rubber slippers, towels and bathrobes were provided near the back door for use in the very private outside shower. There is a camp toilet which along with the foot pump sink is part of the "glamping" experience that made this a fun adventure. From the cupcakes that greeted us to the fresh eggs we cooked in the barn for breakfast, we couldn't have asked for more! Oh! We also were over the moon visiting with the sweetest momma cat and her five adorable kittens!!! If we could have adopted any, we would have begged for at least two. It will be one of the best places you can find to stay in Indiana and I guarantee you won't want to leave!

review_text: Kurt and Heidi were wonderful hosts! We loved relaxing in the hammocks, spending time by the campfire, and getting fresh eggs from the coop! There were so many small touches that made the trip extra special too--like a welcome note with homemade cookies and a note on a book of questions inviting us to get to know each other better. My wife fell in love with Nala, one of their kittens, who was a great hammock snuggle buddy! Kurt was especially attentive and communicative--transporting our farmer's market goods (There is a wonderful farmer's market in town on Saturday mornings!) for us when he noticed that we had bought a little too much to carry back with us to the shed with the bikes that he lent us. We also really enjoyed, and recommend, the kayaking trip! (This would be at a small extra cost and includes kayaks, paddles, life jackets and drop off / pick up.) It was all just what we needed to get away from everyday life!

name: Emmy
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

July 2020
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This place was an amazing retreat into nature and simple living. If you need to clear your mind, get in touch with yourself, focus on art or meditation; this is the place for you. The hosts were so kind and the amenities were unbelievable for the price and quality of the place. I recommend bringing your own grill and food to cook on site. There is a great farmers market in the town on Saturday morning, but otherwise healthy convenient food choices are slim. The camping toilet is really the only rustic part of the amenities so you should be prepared to take care of your own waste. There are some beautiful state parks in the area you can drive to for hiking trails and nature time. The best part by far was meeting the hosts and going on the kayak adventure; they provided the kayak and the drop-off/pick-up. The river was beautiful with a good mix of challenging and relaxing sections which made for a perfect true adventure. Thank you so much Heidi and Kurt for the love and kindness you put into this retreat.

My husband and I can’t thank Kurt and Heidi enough for their hospitality. If you decide to give this place a chance, you will not regret it!! Go for it and give it a try! Have fun!

Stayed with kids
review_text:
My oh my. Rod's place is not only a beautifuly reconditioned Industrial space, but an Art gallery as well. Read his BIO and it explains what I mean.
Entry is easy, lock box and complete instructions. Rod, even sent pictures to help guide us from the street. The stairwell to the 2cd floor is very wide and easy to navigate.
Once inside you have 12' ceilings (at least) and the revamped industrial vibe without being sterile and too modern. CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN. The bathrooms, the floors, everything.
A family of could easily stay her, the kitchen is lovely and well equipped. Even has a dishwasher.
If you are in New Castle, you will miss out if you do not stay with Rod. He himself seems like a charming man and I hope we meet at some point.

This is such a great place to stay! It was a much needed getaway. My favorite Air bnb we have stayed at so far.
From waking up early and seeing the deer come out of the surrounding woods to feed on the corn that they provide, to the beautiful sunrises and the cardinals and blue jays that continue to swoop in for the left over corn, it is evident that Gods peace, beauty and creation is surrounding you.
The Loft is Cozy, comfortable, relaxing, and so peaceful. It is just a short drive into town for dinner or shopping.
The owners are more than helpful with anything you need! It is evident how much they care not only about their beautiful place & property, but also about their visitors comfort & needs! I am definitely looking forward to returning!

Waking up to the morning view from the bedroom window, overlooking the serene woods, was the perfect way to start each day.
The neighborhood is charming and welcoming, adding to the overall positive experience. The tranquility and beauty of the surroundings enhanced our stay and allowed us to unwind and relax in a serene environment. We enjoyed using the grill that is just outside of the apartment.
All the amenities look exactly like in the pictures in the listing. Everything is provided, just bring your shampoo and body wash.
The location is convenient if you need to get to downtown, Kroger, or even Summit Lake State Park. I highly recommend this Airbnb to anyone looking for a cozy and peaceful getaway in a lovely neighborhood.

review_text:
Wonderful stay here for the solar eclipse. It's a large property in beautiful Amish farm country. Very quiet and peaceful. I could hear the faint clop-clop of horse drawn buggies on distant roads, and the railroad couple miles away. Far enough from big cities that you can see many stars.
Apartment is very nice and cozy size for 1 or 2 (400 sq ft). Furnishings comfortable. Kitchen well equipped -- full size fridge / freezer, microwave, toaster oven, K-cup. No stove but didn't miss it. Kitchen well stocked w essentials and snacks. Everything clean. Dish TV and WiFi worked well. You can park right at the door & only 2 steps up into the space. The rest of the building is a large workshop -- all very quiet.
Hosts live in the main house and are very friendly, helpful, and easy to reach. Home-cooked meals and pies were delicious and unexpected. I felt very welcome. Hosts appear new to AirBnB but I can't think of anything to improve. Hope to return someday. Highly recommended!!!

Wow! What a gem tucked in a cute residential neighborhood! We were traveling cross country and needed a place with multiple bedrooms to accommodate our group for an overnight stop. We found this listing and were drawn to the photos and listing. What a joy it was to see the place matched everything described!
This sweet bungalow is on a quiet residential street near the cute downtown.
Off-street parking and super easy entry and we were inside this impeccably decorated home. The hosts have amazing design taste- clutter free but with cute touches that create a cozy space. They thought of everything- comfortable bedding, nice towels, phone chargers and extension cords, cozy lighting, water on nightstands, coffee station and extra drinks in fridge, throw blankets on the couch and a great TV setup. Be sure to spend time on the back deck- at night to enjoy the lighting and in the morning like I did with my cup and coffee and book. Stay here! You’ll love it

This lake home is beautiful 🤩.

Before we even left we wanted to book for our plans this summer together.

My husband and I have three grown children who also have significant others. We had plenty of room for all seven adults. Since there are three floors, we felt we had privacy from each other as well.
The water is shallow by the pier, so getting our kayaks in and out was easy. We noticed the rocks are sharp so bring water shoes if you plan to swim by the pier.
Overall, this is a great family vacation spot!

review_text: Great views of the lake whether sitting inside or hanging out of the large deck, which was a wonderful place to relax. Loved having the dogs with us, the fenced yard was big plus. If you wish to have some swim time with your dogs, be aware that having a sea wall means there is no beach for them to easily get out of the lake - so you're only option is to lift them out and, due to the height of the pier, there is at least 3 feet between the pier and the surface of the water - that's a long way to lift a 40 lb dog. The lake bottom is not sand, so your feet sink and you have no leverage to lift from underneath. Other than that challenge, we had a wonderful time at the lakehouse. It's a beautiful property. Convenient access to restaurants and grocery - we especially loved Rochester Bagels & Harvest Moon. Communication and response from the hosts was great.

The location is perfect for hearing the sound of water, nature and passing boats. There are also a few classic games in the closet for entertainment if you are taking a step away from technology (though a tv is provided in the basement). The owners have also provided a few recommendations regarding local excursions and food that are spot on. No regrets regarding this reservation and would book it a gain in the future. Grateful to the owners for creating a space for guests to enjoy nature and a quaint community.

review_text: The apartment was basically clean when we arrived. However, it was not a comfortable space. The two dining chairs were bar height and have no back. The two chairs in the “living room” are uncomfortable. So there was no place to relax. Neither tv worked - not sure if it was batteries for the remotes or another issue. We did not pursue it because neither was located such that it would be easy to relax and watch tv. Half of the windows lacked screens. We needed to open the windows to air the space out because the air chemical smell was overwhelming when we walked in. I would not recommend this apartment to anyone with respiratory issues, limited mobility (because of the stairs), or a family because of lack of seating or spaces for children or even two couples. This was disappointing. On the plus side it is right downtown.

Overall we loved our stay, the location is perfect and so close to a lot of places. Walking distance to restaurants, coffee shops, the art park and local library. We Will be booking this place again next year when visiting our family.

All bathrooms including laundry are all very well equipped with toilet paper, towels, and a few hygienic products. Every room has a TV which makes it entertaining for family time and for the little ones. Lastly, the house has more than enough space on the backyard which would be very nice to use during the summer time.
Overall, this house is very comfortable and offers all you need for either shorter and longer stays! I would highly recommend it!

The beds were comfortable, the bedding & linens were nice & clean - plenty of pillows, blankets & towels. The kids loved the gaming area downstairs & the outdoor activities. This house is fully equipped for families with a baby, as they provide a basket of toys, books, baby gate for the stairs, playpens, a highchair & even baby silverware! If you're looking for a peaceful country home that feels home from home, don't hesitate to book your stay here! We will absolutely stay here again

Our Christmas gift to our adult children is a family stay at a cabin or Air BnB in February. With 4 spacious bedrooms and 3 full baths, Oak Grove / Cessna house was a perfect home for us, with plenty of amenities for 5 adults and a near-2 year old grandson.
The house was sparkling clean. Each room was decorated in farmhouse style, with well made and comfy furnishings. We cooked all of our meals in the kitchen and there was never a tool we could not find! We also enjoyed the large fireplace in the living room every night!
Outdoors, our grandson enjoyed running outside and fell in love with the swing!
This was a perfect place for our family to slow down, reconnect, and beat the winter blahs.

Plenty of comfortable sleeping spaces for all of us. The woodwork throughout the house is beautifully done and the hosts have thought of EVERYTHING--if we forgot it, they had us covered. The whole house is labelled so you are not searching cabinets and drawers to find stuff. The location is perfect--secluded, but activities, shops, winery, walmart, and groceries are a short drive. The U-Pick flowers was wonderful!! I just can't say enough about our weekend and the comfort, cleanliness, communication, and friendliness that was shown by DeAnn and her family!!

review_text:
We just finished staying here for the second time: and we'll probably come back again one day, because we can rely on the Cessna House at Oak Grove Place to be everything an Airbnb should be. The house is spotlessly clean, the hosts are extremely responsive (they live right next door), and there are a lot of nice extras like the farm-fresh eggs they provide when you check-in and the chickens that wander the property. Check-in is a breeze, they just send you the code and you type it on the keypad.
It's not the most exciting part of Indiana, but we were able to do an aggressive tourist schedule that involved visiting the nearby cities of Wabash (site of a 1826 treaty between the US govt and Indians and the first city with electric lighting), Marion (hometown of Garfield creator Jim Davis), Peru (home to a US Air Force museum with Cold War bombers), Kokomo (where the first car in America was built), Logansport (nice hiking trails along the river), Warsaw (a beautiful city between two lakes), and a few others, all of which were within a 45 minute or so drive. We even took a day trip to Indianapolis, though that was a 2 hour drive one way.
Of course if you just wanted to relax inside your entire stay, the house is great for that too. There are a million DVDs and the internet connection is good.

This charming home was one of the best places we've stayed at. It is beautifully redone and had plenty of room for everyone in our 7 person group.
The master suite was absolutely amazing! Not only huge, but it had a private bathroom with a deep jacuzzi tub that melted all my stress away. The beds was comfortable.
Our family had a blast playing the Wii, watching movies from the very large selection. The table in the dining room was perfect for family dinners and board games. We also spent a lot of time having friendly competitions of pool, foosball, checkers & shuffle board.
All the thoughtful things the host did just put it over the top- from farm fresh eggs in the fridge to the beautiful Christmas decorations & tree to the firewood ready and waiting for the beautiful fireplace.
Daniel was sweet man who made sure everything was right for us. We were all enchanted with our stay and are planning on returning!

So many game boards, Nintendo Wii, shuffle board, pool, foosball, washers etc. 4 bedrooms with all nice size beds and 3 showers is another great feature of this place. No one is on top of each other at all. Big finding room table and endless places to sit whether you’re indoor or outdoor you pretty much can always be comfortable. Despite being an old, historic house, all of the appliances, bathrooms, and fixtures were brand new and up to date. The fridge was stocked with basic food (including farm fresh eggs from the chickens that roam the property) and the kitchen was stocked with all the cooking utensils and tools you can think of. There were also a lot of thoughtful touches like games, books, and toys. The backyard is huge and contained, among other things, swings and a tether ball. This house could easily and comfortably fit a large party, and having it all to ourselves made me and my wife feel like the king and queen of Indiana. Overall, this is one of the most remarkable properties we have ever stayed at, anywhere in the world.

name: David
rating_info:

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Oak Grove Place is a lovely country get-away. It is large and spacious both inside and out. It was very neat and clean, and had all sorts of special amenities, like farm fresh eggs in the fridge, plush rocking patio chairs on the front porch, and beautiful views across the fields. My wife and I grew up in a rural setting. And Oak Grove Place was a wonderful return to all those feelings and memories. The owner was very kind, friendly, and helpful when we needed him. Check in was super easy. And we had all the privacy we were looking for in a country setting. Our stay was just the sort of quiet and restfulness we were looking for. We were able to find classic town diners and burger joints in downtown Rochester in the evenings -and ice cream shops too! Will definitely return in the future. A perfect retreat from the hustle and bustle.

Everything was labeled clearly with great directions and we found everything we needed when cooking meals in the fully stocked kitchen. The beds were really comfortable. Overall, a fantastic place to stay and we are already planning on coming back again.

review_text: This place is beautiful! It’s the perfect place to get away from city life! The deck is wonderful and it overlooks a big green beautiful backyard with big fields behind it. The house itself clean and welcoming... and gorgeous! So historic and lovely! Loved the farm fresh eggs and breakfast options! We had a blast playing shuffleboard and pool downstairs during the rain, and soaked up the sun and privacy outside when the weather was nice. There’s a fire pit, with everything you need to get it going so bring stuff for s’mores! Great for a big family or a couple just looking for some peace and quiet. We had a wonderful stay and hope to return again in the fall!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Daniel's family was a pleasure to interact with and made sure everything went perfectly. The house is just far enough outside of town to be a quiet getaway, but close enough for easy access to stores and restaurants.
The kitchen, bathrooms, and living spaces have all been nicely renovated and updated. Some of the original farmhouse features have also been preserved, such as the pocket doors to the front seating area and much of the woodwork around the house. There is a roomy deck and backyard with a grill and fire pit which would be enjoyable in the warmer weather. With the amount of space in and outside of the house, Daniel's place is a great option for families. Daniel's family also left some delicious farm fresh eggs from their chickens.
Highly recommended and in my opinion a much better value and experience than staying in a motel in town. I would definitely stay here again if I'm back in the Rochester area.

I cannot speak more favorably about Stephanie‘s cabin and her hospitality.

Stephanie and I have some mutual local friends. They all spoke so highly of her that I felt like I had known her all my life.
I have a high school reunion coming up next fall and I will guarantee you I will be staying right here at Stephanie‘s cabin.
Any guest that is looking for a comfortable quiet Airbnb anywhere in the area should check this place out. Pretty special.
